name: buoyantly
content:
buoyantly adverb
(FLOATING)
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that relates to floating or the ability to float: They were sailing swiftly and buoyantly on long rocking waves. The kite gets its name from the kite family of birds, which float buoyantly in the sky.
More examplesFewer examplesWarm glacial ice was able to rise buoyantly towards the surface.Mantle plumes are columns of hot rock that rise buoyantly from the earth’s deep mantle.

buoyantly adverb
(HAPPY)
in a happy and confident way: It was a buoyantly funny comedy. The dancers bounce buoyantly to marimba music on the village square.
More examplesFewer examplesShe raced buoyantly through the house.I felt at ease, buoyantly happy, confident.The amazingly talented and buoyantly youthful cast lights up the stage buoyantly.
